title: Lighten up Night Mode so parts of UI can be seen
message:
Lighten up Night Mode so parts of UI can be seen

Some parts of the UI, like the underline beneath text fields, are pure
black. If we use a pure black background for Night Mode, then those
black elements will meld in with the background and appear invisible.

title: Make red & purple text more legible in Night Mode
message:
Make red & purple text more legible in Night Mode

Closes #5

title: Add confirmation before uploading to Dropbox
message:
Add confirmation before uploading to Dropbox

Closes #4

message:
Allow files with . prefix to upload to Dropbox

Fixes #1.

title: Show AlertDialog instead of Toast after upload
message:
Show AlertDialog instead of Toast after upload

This way, the user won't miss the outcome of the upload, unlike with
Toast.

title: Enhance Dropbox-related strings
message:
Enhance Dropbox-related strings

The Sync to Dropbox item text should be shorter so that it isn't cut off
in the overflow menu.

To compensate for the ambiguity of removing "World" from the item text,
"World" is no shown in the title of the upload ProgressDialog.

title: Lengthen duration of Dropbox Toast messages
message:
Lengthen duration of Dropbox Toast messages

Since the loading may take some time, the user may not be looking at the
screen when uploading finishes. Lengthening the duration of the Toast
makes it more likely that they will see the outcome.

title: Show a ProgressDialog while uploading to Dropbox
message: Show a ProgressDialog while uploading to Dropbox

title: Upload files to Dropbox recursively
message:
Upload files to Dropbox recursively

The Dropbox API cannot upload folders explicitly, so we need to traverse
the World folder and upload each file individually.

title: Sync files to Dropbox when selected from menu
message: Sync files to Dropbox when selected from menu

title: Create UploadToDropboxTask
message: Create UploadToDropboxTask

title: Sync to Dropbox during onResume after authenticate
message:
Sync to Dropbox during onResume after authenticate

Authentication interrupts the flow of syncWorldToDropbox, so syncing
will happen when ArticleListActivity resumes after authentication.

title: ArticleListActivity: Fix menu option actions
message:
ArticleListActivity: Fix menu option actions

The case block for syncToDropboxItem was too far down the case
structure, taking up the cases for renameWorldItem, loadWorldItem,
and deleteWorldItem. This caused the latter three cases to all execute
the Dropbox operations, rather than their appropriate operations.

Moving the case block for syncToDropboxItem above the latter three cases
fixes this issue.

title: ArticleListActivity: APP_KEY -> DROPBOX_APP_KEY
message:
ArticleListActivity: APP_KEY -> DROPBOX_APP_KEY

This is to clarify that the key is strictly for Dropbox purposes.

title: Authenticate Dropbox account during first sync
message: Authenticate Dropbox account during first sync

title: AppPreferences: Add Dropbox Access Token constant
message:
AppPreferences: Add Dropbox Access Token constant

This token will be used to access the user's account on Dropbox servers.
It will be stored in SharedPreferences; in this way, we can use
dropboxAccessToken exists to check that the user has already linked
their account and, if so, use the existing token without requiring
another authentication.

title: Add Sync to Dropbox item in ArticleList menu
message: Add Sync to Dropbox item in ArticleList menu

message:
Switch to Dropbox API v2

API v1 is deprecated.

message:
Reduce bottom padding in ArticleListActivity

This is to accomodate the shorter height of the new BottomBar.
The previous padding was too much, making it appear is if there were a
white line just above the BottomBar.

message:
BottomBar: Remove setVisibility

BottomBar extends RelativeLayout, which already implements
setVisibility.

message:
Use BottomBar class in SelectArticleActivity

These dimensions are more in line with Google's Material Design
guidelines.

message: Redraw and shrink BottomBar icons

message:
Change icon color when selecting BottomBar button

...Rather than the background color of the entire button.

This gives the BottomBar a sleeker and more modern appearance.

title: Reduce BottomBar text size
message: Reduce BottomBar text size

title: Remove Category name from ArticleList app bar
message:
Remove Category name from ArticleList app bar

Showing the current Category name in the app bar is redundant, now that
the same information is displayed in the BottomBar.

title: BottomBar: Show name only for active Category
message: BottomBar: Show name only for active Category

title: highlightCategoryButton -> focusCategoryButton
message:
highlightCategoryButton -> focusCategoryButton

The new method name more accurately communicates the method's purpose,
as highlighting is just one part of bringing the button into focus.
Highlighting is now its own method, and hiding/showing text will be
their own methods as well.

title: BottomBar: Write and use getCategoryButton
message:
BottomBar: Write and use getCategoryButton

Some refactoring to eliminate future redundancies.

title: BottomBar: Remove layoutWeight from dummy layout
message:
BottomBar: Remove layoutWeight from dummy layout

layoutWeight is invalid for the parent layout (a FrameLayout).

title: Add a "dummy" layout to space out BottomBar
message:
Add a "dummy" layout to space out BottomBar

The plan is to only display the currently-selected Category's name
on the BottomBar. This means that the other TextViews should have their
visibility set to GONE... but this comes with the side-effect of
shrinking each non-active button's height, making the background color
"strip" have uneven height.

To remedy this, a "dummy" layout has been placed that contains just one
button and TextView, both of which are set to INVISIBLE (unseen but
still taking up space). The background color has also been migrated to
the root layout, whose height is now fixed to match that of the "dummy"
layout at all times.

This acts as a "safeguard" for every situation in which folders go
missing, as many users have already experienced.

title: Check if Connection Category folder exists
message:
Check if Connection Category folder exists

...before attempting to read from it.

This is because some devices seemingly refuse to create an empty folder,
so there is a chance that a Connection Category folder wasn't created
during Article creation.

items to be sorted.

title: Dismiss Article link dialogs when pausing Activity
message:
Dismiss Article link dialogs when pausing Activity

This prevents the app from crashing due to RecyclerView mismatches from
reloading data during onResume. (For example, pausing and resuming the
app while the 'Delete Article' dialog is displayed would cause an error
because the index of the ViewHolders changes during onResume.)

title: Use Residence class in Residence-related Adapters
message: Use Residence class in Residence-related Adapters

title: Create Residence class
message:
Create Residence class

Though the ResidencesAdapter and ResidentsAdapter only really need a
list of Strings, using lists with a dedicated data class has some
benefits:

* A Residence object can be passed to ExternalWriter and ExternalDeleter
  for saving/deletion with all of the needed info, significantly cutting
  down on the parameters that need to be passed.
* The Residence class maintains consistency with the Connection and
  Membership data classes.
* If new fields ever need to be added to Residences in the future, they
  can be added to the class without needing any major changes to the
  Adapters or ExternalReader/Writer/Deleter.

title: Use empty String to show no role in Membership
message:
Use empty String to show no role in Membership

When a Membership is saved with an empty role via
EditMembershipActivity, the text file that is produced contains a
newline character.

When this text file is read, it returns an empty string instead of null
due to the newline character.

As such, in order for the role TextView to be properly hidden on
Membership cards, the card must check whether membership.memberRole is
empty, rather than null.

new Connections/Memberships/Residences.

title: Make Other Article in Connection uneditable
message:
Make Other Article in Connection uneditable

This is to prevent possible weirdness that may result from being
able to change the connected Article from the EditConnectionActivity.
(e.g. setting the Connection to another Article who already has a
Connection to the main Article.)

The user can quickly delete the Connection and then make a new one,
so changing the connected Article isn't a feature one would need
anyway.

title: Get EditTexts directly in getTextFields
message:
Get EditTexts directly in getTextFields

The Article subclasses' attributes are not yet set when getTextFields is
called, so those attribtues would have null references at the time.
As such, getTextFields uses findViewById instead, in order to retrieve
the EditTexts directly.

title: Remove loadData call in ArticleTextField init
message:
Remove loadData call in ArticleTextField init

Since the text fields are initialized before the layout is inflated, the
EditTexts haven't been created yet. Thus, calling setText in loadData
would cause an error.

title: Access Article text fields in ArticleActivity
message: Access Article text fields in ArticleActivity

title: Create ArticleTextField class
message:
Create ArticleTextField class

This class allows for encapsulation of EditTexts across the different
ArticleActivity subclasses that all share the same functionality:
reading from and writing to text files that are named after the text
field's "name."

Because it is generalized to work with any Category of Activity, this
class can be used in the ArticleActivity abstract class and thus
eliminate repetitive code for loading text field data within the
Article subclasses. (As well as prevent future repetition in saving
text field data.)
